Serbia

Group E | Europe

Gibanica

When he's not being traded about by Jose Mourinho, Nemanja Matić is looking around for another slice of this cheese pie. Gibanica is known throughout the Balkans, and here we present a Serbian version.

Mother Would Know's Gibanica has the tangy bite of feta, but with the fluffy texture of a quiche, this vegetarian-friendly dish is more that it seems.

  • Time 1hr 15min
  • Makes 8
  • Difficulty Professional
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 3 Eggs
    3
    3
    Eggs
  • 450g Ricotta cheese
    1lb
    450g
    Ricotta cheese
  • 450g Feta cheese
    1lb
    450g
    Feta cheese
  • 3 tbsp Sour cream
    3 tbsp
    3 tbsp
    Sour cream
  • 80ml Milk
    1/3 cup
    80ml
    Milk
  • 80ml Seltzer
    1/3 cup
    80ml
    Seltzer
  • 1 tsp Dried dill
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Dried dill
  • 50g Butter
    4 tbsp
    50g
    Butter melted
  • 4 tbsp Olive oil
    4 tbsp
    4 tbsp
    Olive oil
  • 450g Filo dough
    1lb
    450g
    Filo dough
  • 1
    In a large bowl whisk together the eggs, ricotta, feta, sour cream, milk and seltzer. Once combined add the dill and season with salt and pepper.
  • 2
    Preheat the oven to 375°F190°C. Melt the butter in a small dish and add olive oil. Grease a 9 x 11.5" baking dish with the butter and olive oil mixture. Set the dish and filo dough side by side.
  • 3
    Place a sheet of filo dough on the bottom of the dish, brush with butter and oil. While the dough is moist, add another sheet. Repeat until you've used 1/3 of the sheets of filo.
    Coach's tip You will need to work quickly, as the dough will dry out in open air.
    Coach's tip You will need to work quickly, as the dough will dry out in open air.
  • 4
    Pour half the cheese mixture into the dish.
  • 5
    Start the second layer of filo dough, repeating the process above, until you've used another 1/3 of the dough. Pour the rest of the cheese mixture into the dish. Cover with the rest of the dough.
  • 6
    Brush the last piece of dough with the last of the butter and oil mixture.
  • 7
    Bake for 45 minutes or until the mixture is cooked through. It should resemble the texture of a quiche when finished.
